but it is only a trick. March on, destroy the Russian army. . . . You are in a position to seize its baggage and artillery. 
The Russian Emperor's aide-de-camp is an im- postor. Officers are nothing when they have no powers; this one had none. . . . The Austrians let themselves be tricked at the crossing of the Vienna bridge, you are letting yourself be tricked by an aide-de-camp of the Emperor. 
NAPOLEON 
Bonaparte's adjutant rode full gallop with this menacing letter to Murat. Bonaparte hi
